title: Personnel Evaluations related to Building & Code Administration officials (Volusia County, Florida Human Resources)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act request pursuant to Florida Sunshine Law.  

I hereby request the below information for the following Volusia County Building & Code Administration personnel: Kerry Leuzinger, Paul Traider, and Jeff Bergman.

1) Performance evaluations and/or employee reviews for the past 36 months
2) Employer memos, notes and reports from employee's performance evaluations for the past 36 months
3) Write-ups of any internal or external employee disputes filed in the past 36 months.
4) Any complaints or disputes filed or reported via phone, email, letter or other means of communication regarding the employee's conduct during the past 36 months.
5) Videotape or phone video recordings of official activity while in public view during the course of work during the past 36 months.
6) Drug screenings and results, including requests for drug screenings not voluntarily undertaken, for the past during the past 36 months.
7) Mental health evaluations conducted within the past 36 months.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge, processed by a representative of the news media/press, and is not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

I would prefer the request be filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Should my request be refused, kindly provide the specific legislative citation for the rejection, as required by Section 119.07(1)(d) of the Florida Statutes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within a reasonable time frame, according to Section 119.07(1)(a),(c) of the Florida Statutes.

Sincerely,

Lourdes Gonzalez

title: Stop Work Order notices issued in Volusia County (2020-present) (Volusia County Building & Code Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request for a public record made pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law Freedom of Information Act. 

I hereby request the following information: 

Any and all records pertaining to Stop Work Orders issued against residential properties in Volusia County by code enforcement officials Paul Traider, or Jeff Bergman, or Kerry Leuzinger, between January 1, 2020 to present.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge, processed by a representative of the news media/press, and is not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

I would prefer the request be filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Should my request be refused, kindly provide the specific legislative citation for the rejection, as required by Section 119.07(1)(d) of the Florida Statutes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within a reasonable time frame, according to Section 119.07(1)(a),(c) of the Florida Statutes.

Sincerely,

Lourdes Gonzalez

title: Sounds Of New York City (SONYC) documentation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for documentation related to the Sounds of New York City (SONYC) noise sensors and their management. Specifically, I am interested in any technology documentation (including but not limited to manuals, tutorials, or presentations) on how the sensors detect noises. As well as any enforcement documentation (including but not limited to policies, plans, or memorandums) on how noise data is stored and shared with the Department of Environmental Protection (and any other NY agencies including NYPD) for noise violation enforcement.

To help you locate your relevant records, here is public documentation online that this tool was designed by the design firm Loft LLC (now Nova and Loft Designs) and paid for with a $5 mil NSF grant. See the documentation below.

* https://www.nyc.gov/assets/ddc/downloads/town-and-gown/SONYC.2%20Precis.FINAL.pdf
* https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1544753

I am a researcher looking to better understand how data informs strategic noise enforcement in NYC. I would appreciate these results as soon as possible and am happy to receive records on a rolling basis as they are made available. I am happy to discuss in more detail what I am looking for if helpful at rebecca@rebeccawilliams.info

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Login.gov Cost Estimator Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request for all documentation related to estimating costs for state partners procuring Login.gov services from Feb 18, 2021 - present.

For your reference the Login.gov state and local partnership program was announced here: https://www.gsa.gov/blog/2021/02/18/logingov-to-provide-authentication-and-identity-proofing-services-to-a-limited-number-of-federally-funded-state-and-local-government-programs and a description of how states and local partners can pursue purchasing the Login.gov services according to a cost estimator is described here: https://www.login.gov/partners/state-and-local/#intergovernmental-cooperation-act-igca-process. 

Specifically, I am requesting the following type of records: 
- Any documentation on the cost estimator criteria;
- Any records, such as emails, from states or local governments requesting to use the cost estimator; 
- Any presentations or memos related to the revenue of the state and local partnership program.

These records will be used to inform research on digital identity best practices. Because of our not-for-profit status and the fact that this request is about a matter in the public interest, I request a fee waiver. If you have any questions or would like to discuss narrowing the request, please contact me directly at rebecca@rebeccawilliams.info.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Records related to new software for AB481 data collection

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, including emails and attachments of RPD staff, purchase orders and contracts, for Richmond's use or acquisition of software or other systems designed to register data on the use of military equipment by law enforcement agencies in California. 

On February 5, 2024, in a community engagement meeting presented by the Richmond Police Department, Captain John Lopez stated that "there's new software now that just come out that's for law enforcement in order to collect AB481. Because this is not just specific to Richmond, it's for all you know all law enforcement agencies within California... I've been uh talking to a lot of other departments about how they've been collecting the data and collecting the stuff they need for their reports." See https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1lfwodFVIs at minute: 50:51. 

We are seeking records that shed light on the software, and record keeping systems that Captain Lopez referenced, what types of data they are designed to collect, and the providers and costs of such systems.

If you have any questions regarding this request, please don't hesitate to reach out to me directly, at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Buffalo PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Buffalo Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

files.title: ~WRD2418
files.source: New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, New York

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Amherst PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Amherst Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

all correspondence (letters, emails), with attachments, between George Gauthier of the Evanston Housing Coalition (EHC) and any City of Evanston staff or elected/appointed officials from January 1, 2015 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

all correspondence (letters, emails), with attachments, between Richard Koenig of the Housing Opportunity Development Corporation (HODC) and any City of Evanston staff or elected/appointed officials from January 1, 2015 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

Niles Coalition

Kristin Reed

title: 2007 Prg "Glamour" Infection at Dept. of Transportation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2007 Prg "Glamour" Infection at Dept. of Transportation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records you may hold on the ransomware, computer virus, trojan horse, malware, or malicious software named "NTOS", "Prg" or "Wsnpoem". It is also known as "Glamorous", "GLAMOUR", "Zeus", or "Zbot". I am seeking records from the years 2006-2008.

Reuters reported on an infection/hack/theft in an August 9, 2007 piece titled "Hackers steal U.S. govt, corporate data from PCs". This article is available at:

https://www.reuters.com/article/us-internet-attack/hackers-steal-u-s-government-corporate-data-from-pcs-idUSN1638118020070717/

Reuters was referencing a company called Prevx which wrote a blog article on July 16, 2007 titled "Ransomware... Holding Corporate America Ransom!". This post is archived at:

https://web.archive.org/web/20071022014355/http://www.prevx.com/blog/31/Ransomware-Holding-Corporate-America-Ransom.html

The article says that the U.S. Dept. of Transportation was a victim:

"Translating the logfiles on the server to meaningful data was quite easy, ...

152.120.156.x, US, Maryland, Bladensburg, U.S. Dept. of Transportation"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dennis Schwarz

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jessica Cabrera, 
 
Thank you for contacting the University of Nevada, Las Vegas Public Records Center. 
 
We created an account for you to track and monitor the status of your public records request, receive updates, and access any records released to you. PLEASE NOTE: .  Check the account periodically to receive updates. if we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days 
 
 
If you are new to this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. ( (https://universityofnevada.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(cl4ugwa4yb1hpexumq5rq4z5))/ForgotPassword.aspx?sSessionID=&caller=%2fWEBAPP%2f_rs%2fLogin.aspx%3fsSessionID%3d) *check your spam or junk email folder for the reset password instructions. 
 
 
Your Login ID is:  160925-19444045@requests.muckrock.com 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center (https://universityofnevada.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(siauyigdo45urd2mxwcyy3rj))/supporthome.aspx) 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas This is an auto-genera ted email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R001734-032124
communications.communication:
Dear Jessica Cabrera: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records from the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.  Your request was received in the Office of Public Affairs on 3/21/2024 and given the request number R001734-032124 to track its progress, receive updates, and access any records released to you. 
 You requested: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all records regarding members of staff, faculty, and administration's status of completion for Title IX training provided by the University of Nevada, Las Vegas for the academic year of 2023-2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-of-nevada-las-vegas-5507%252Ftitle-ix-training-completion-160925%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords%252540unlv.edu&url_auth_token=AAAvj_4QBv6zHnXm8DZIi7UBBcM%3A1rnTAY%3AbsPSScplqHLjKF08LaDyYWgyq5wPnNL1lXPgrBZCfwY" 
 
Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 Regularly monitor the progress of your request in My Request Center 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

title: CPS: Transportation x Disability Category x Race

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Transportation x Disability Category x Race
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show:

1. The total number of students who check "Yes" in the Transportation section of an IEP in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024. Please provide this data by disability category broken down by race per disability category. 

2. The total number of students who have IEPs in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race per disability category.

3. The total number of students who have Behavior Intervention Plans in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race.

4. The total number of students who have Behavior Intervention Plans and check "Yes" in the Transportation section of an IEP in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race by disability category. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

3. The total number of students who have Behavior Intervention Plans in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-transportation-x-disability-category-x-race-160921%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9RYhgoBNi1Pb8mf_KKixYw%3A1rnT8a%3AT5TuTAsZIo3Q8i5VFuxLhb5f1Hc_EwQRRtUvJQ5gCoo 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15064

communications.communication:

title: Title IX complaints - University of Nevada, Las Vegas

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Title IX complaints - University of Nevada, Las Vegas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all Title IX complaints involving The University of Nevada, Las Vegas during the academic years 2021-2022, 2022-2023, 2023-2024
- Any records relating to Title IX complaints filed from January 1, 2024 to the present date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Title IX Annual Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all records related to the Title IX annual report announced by Brian Sandoval on Oct. 13, 2023  (Reference to the related article: https://www.unr.edu/nevada-today/news/president-messages/2023-10-13-information-and-updates-on-the-office-of-equal-opportunity-and-title-ix )
- Any and all communications regarding the creation and development of the Title IX report
- Spreadsheets or documents on the raw data from the report, provided as a .pdf or .csv file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera
